content.body: is there a matrix/slack/etc like this community but for unicode?

Fernando Fiori: I think what you want to be able to defend is why entry here is correct. Note that I gave some a reason in that discussion as to why it is not (you end up looking at the wrong ancestor chain).

content.body: nektro: I think Unicode is fairly closed, but if you find something that contradicts that, please let me know. (There might still be a public mailing list though.)
content.formatted_body: nektro: I think Unicode is fairly closed, but if you find something that contradicts that, please let me know. (There might still be a public mailing list though.)

content.body: Unicode has a slack instance, though it's not well advertised. Here's a joining link: https://join.slack.com/t/unicode-org/shared_invite/zt-3ntrn2geu-i81l1gMJGnYZ33TayeZXXQ

IMHO having eemeli around with his ears on here may be more useful than what could be got from discussion wherever else it might be taking place (including that dedicated Slack instance for Unicode he mentioned)
